Description: Fragment of wool, plain weave textile, mainly pale pink (discoloured), with part of a tapestry roundel (single warp threads) multicoloured on a dark blue ground; Several stylised plant motifs, wave border; A cord (2 ply Z, wool?) at back must belong to same textile but appears to be in the wrong place; Warp: S spun, c.12 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.16 tpc in plain areas, c.42 per cm in tapestry; Edges: ragged
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Probably from a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (8.11.89)
Condition: Fragmentary; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
